definition: ratio seventy to thirty/thirty percent failure, seventy percent success

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
thirty percent failure, seventy percent success, the official PRC verdict on Mao Zedong

sentences.english: The general assessment of his work is 70% achievements and 30% mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 大家认为他的功过是三七开。

sentences.english: Evaluation on this person about whether his achievements and demerits were a thirty-seventy ratio is still debated now.
sentences.chinese: 评价这个人物是否能够三七开，目前还有争论。

definition: to bring to the same level/to even up/to flare out/to flatten out
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
(after a sum has been paid in advance) to refund (in case of overpayment) or be reimbursed (in case of underpayment)
endgame/conclusion/outcome/final part of a chess game
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
